etymologies: Old English; earliest use found in Crist I. Cognate with or formed similarly to Middle Dutch sorgeloos (Dutch zorgeloos), Middle High German sorgelōs (German sorglos, sorgenlos), Old Icelandic sorglauss, sorgalauss, Old Swedish sorghalös (Swedish sorglös), Danish sorgløs from the Germanic base of sorrow + the Germanic base of -less

notes.text: In Old English also: †free from care or anxiety, secure (obsolete).
